To think that within 5 years, we could have back numerous unknown Greek treasures is pretty exciting.", "like_count": 38, "published_at": "2024-02-10T12:55:39Z", "updated_at": "2024-02-10T12:55:39Z"}, {"author": "@gargleblasta", "text": "That is how science is done: competition, cooperation and sharing your knowledge", "like_count": 123, "published_at": "2024-02-07T19:57:36Z", "updated_at": "2024-02-07T19:57:36Z"}, {"author": "@shawnirwin6633", "text": "What I would love to see would be the writings of Democritus (Plato said all his books should be burned . . . well, maybe they were burned, ha ha, by Vesuvius, and that would be a good thing in this case), but the idea of reading books from Democritus, who was a world traveler, called the laughing philosopher, and even more interesting, hated by Plato is pretty appealing.
The full set of Livy's "The History of Rome" is a monumental work covering the legendary foundation of Rome by Romulus and Remus in 753 BC up to Livy's own time in the early 1st century BC. It consists of 142 books, although only a fraction of them have survived in their entirety. Livy's narrative provides a detailed account of Rome's rise to power, its wars, political developments, and the deeds of its notable figures.
And the Sabellian books, also known as the Sibylline Books, a collection of prophecies and oracles attributed to the Sibyls, ancient prophetesses in the Greco-Roman world. These books were highly revered by the Romans and consulted during times of crisis or uncertainty to seek guidance on religious matters, state affairs, and military campaigns.", "like_count": 9, "published_at": "2024-02-10T11:51:27Z", "updated_at": "2024-02-10T11:51:27Z"}, {"author": "@skepticalgenious", "text": "That actually makes sense. The part where he looked at it until he noticed something. I mean we are pattern seeking beings.", "like_count": 9, "published_at": "2024-02-13T00:54:09Z", "updated_at": "2024-02-13T00:54:09Z"}, {"author": "@marinoceccotti9155", "text": "I've been waiting for this to happen for decades. Imagine the discovery of the lost works of Heraclitus or other lost works of prominent philosophers.", "like_count": 36, "published_at": "2024-02-09T23:49:17Z", "updated_at": "2024-02-09T23:49:17Z"}, {"author": "@jamiegraham6525", "text": "Outstanding collection of information by the creator. I've referenced numerous updates on the scrolls, all more recent than this, most of which are not nearly as comprehensive and informative. Thank you!", "like_count": 1, "published_at": "2024-03-10T23:18:04Z", "updated_at": "2024-03-10T23:18:04Z"}, {"author": "@velvetvideo", "text": "I'd personally love to see AI look at every major religious text in existence and find all the correllation points (like flood accounts, messiah figures, philosophical breakdown and points of contention and come up with a history of myths, religions, beliefs, migration and interpretations in a "Cliff's Notes" style of summation.", "like_count": 6, "published_at": "2024-02-11T22:13:27Z", "updated_at": "2024-02-11T22:13:27Z"}, {"author": "@Preciouspink", "text": "Good breakdown of this whole project and methodology used", "like_count": 8, "published_at": "2024-02-07T16:31:23Z", "updated_at": "2024-02-07T16:31:23Z"}, {"author": "@warty3620", "text": "Here's a use that doesn't involve state control, big farma, and Big Brother . . . and I'm fascinated,  because I love ancient history and the thought one can resurrect lost manuscripts is a dream that may well come true.", "like_count": 8, "published_at": "2024-02-11T06:15:46Z", "updated_at": "2024-02-11T06:15:46Z"}, {"author": "@EdSurridge", "text": "Great episode", "like_count": 1, "published_at": "2025-01-06T10:50:28Z", "updated_at": "2025-01-06T10:50:28Z"}, {"author": "@kevincrady2831", "text": "I can't wait! AI should also be able to speed up the translation process, as soon as someone feeds an LLM a bunch of the Greco-Roman texts we already have.", "like_count": 3, "published_at": "2024-02-10T15:09:48Z", "updated_at": "2024-02-10T15:09:48Z"}, {"author": "@elvishiekios8826", "text": "Menandros was a more popular comedian than Aristophanes. He wrote ~120 comedies and only one survived about a grumpy father in law. There may comedies by him in these scrolls or works of Archimedes the renowned mathematician  of Syracuse. So there are a lot we look forward to in the next three years.
HOW WONDERFUL PEOPLE ARE WHEN THEY COOPERATE INSTEAD OF KILLING EACH OTHER!", "like_count": 1, "published_at": "2024-02-12T23:15:27Z", "updated_at": "2024-02-12T23:15:27Z"}, {"author": "@KGTiberius", "text": "📍 1st time viewer. Instant subscriber. Greatly appreciate the long format, citation, storytelling/narrative, and comparative dissemination. Keep up,the excellent work.🤙", "like_count": 9, "published_at": "2024-02-12T04:53:38Z", "updated_at": "2024-02-12T04:53:38Z"}, {"author": "@winsomehax", "text": "If we're really lucky... it won't uncover just great documents. The real diamonds are the everyday stuff that people may have stored for reference, but never expected them them to be of interest 1000s of years later. The written note of a grievance by a guardsman against his boss... some uber nerd collector keeping an schedule of cleaning)... whatever. The stuff that we always assumed was completely lost to history - and is truly a treasure to the curious 1000 years later. there may not be much as the equivalent of paper then was costly... but there will be some.", "like_count": 8, "published_at": "2024-02-07T11:56:23Z", "updated_at": "2024-02-07T11:56:23Z"}, {"author": "@Guytron95", "text": "MRI should do a cheaper scanning job. Don't think the big expensive machine in a hospital, picture a machine just big enough to hold a scroll. Far less material shielding, magnetic coil, energy and sensor bandwidth would be needed while the smaller scale would allow far higher resolution scanning. And MRI can discern different chemical signatures, its original purpose in the chemistry lab after all.", "like_count": 1, "published_at": "2024-02-13T02:01:14Z", "updated_at": "2024-02-13T02:01:14Z"}, {"author": "@chrisvielle6629", "text": "I for one love AI. I hope it remembers that when it scrubs the history of humans social media activities upon determining who to exterminate.", "like_count": 25, "published_at": "2024-02-07T06:31:29Z", "updated_at": "2024-02-07T06:31:29Z"}, {"author": "@happy17761492", "text": "What a very interesting lecture. title: The Surprising Reason AI WON’T Take Your Job

[{"author": "@netscrooge", "text": "That MIT article is based on an analysis of vision systems that have existed, not the vision systems that are in the process of being invented.  For example, they consider systems that require a local engineering team for deployment.  

They calculate how the economics will change if the price drops a certain percentage per year.  That's like when people decades ago projected our current EV adoption rate based on our continuing to use EVs with lead-acid batteries.  No matter how carefully they projected advancements in lead-acid battery technology or the future cost of lead, their analysis isn't relevant to what we're actually experiencing today.  Our EVs are not 1960s tech EVs made cheaper at larger scales. 

Intellectually, it's an academic trap.  The article's authors can't base their projections on speculations about tech that hasn't been invented yet.  The only way they can be taken seriously is to base their analysis on assumptions that are absurd.  Everyone knows we won't be using 2020 AI tech in 2030 let alone 2040.  But that's the academic game.", "like_count": 1, "published_at": "2024-01-30T15:41:38Z", "updated_at": "2024-01-30T15:41:38Z"}, {"author": "@hibou647", "text": "As if ai enhancement meant no  jobs being replaced. What we are seeing is that Ai aided senior devs need twice as few juniors to perform the same tasks. Second, the MIT article is focusing on computer vision, which is not the area where jobs are immediately most at risk which are text based (coding, law, translation, etc.). Is this the best assessment we can make? Then maybe AI should take over 😂", "like_count": 2, "published_at": "2024-01-24T11:28:22Z", "updated_at": "2024-01-24T11:28:57Z"}, {"author": "@GatherVerse", "text": "Not true. I don't see where women of such age will find any other job when all cashiers will be machines, in cleaning hotels?-a much cheaper and physically harder when you're in 60s. Many will be forced to work in 60s when social support from state will be small, or after marriage partner death you left with expensive apartment to maintain but in good part of city, etc", "like_count": 0, "published_at": "2024-01-24T03:00:34Z", "updated_at": "2024-01-24T03:00:34Z"}, {"author": "@carkawalakhatulistiwa", "text": "Many  anime translator already replace by ai ❤", "like_count": 0, "published_at": "2024-01-24T12:51:05Z", "updated_at": "2024-01-24T12:51:15Z"}, {"author": "@BrightMatolo", "text": "`∆ I believe we are meant to be like Jesus in our hearts and not in our flesh. But be careful of Artificial Intelligence (AI), for it knows only things of the flesh such as our fleshly desires (without fear of God) and cannot comprehend things of the Spirit such as true love and eternal joy that comes from obeying God's Word [Galatians 5:16-26]. Man is a spirit and has a soul but lives in a body which is flesh. When you go to bed it is the flesh that sleeps, but your spirit never sleeps and that is why you have dreams, unless you have died in peace physically. More so, true love that endures and last is a thing of the heart. When I say 'heart', I mean 'spirit'. But fake love, pretentious love, love with expectations, love for classic reasons, love for material reasons (love because of material needs) and love for selfish reasons outside God those are things of the flesh. In the beginning God said let us make man in our own image, according to our likeness. Take note, God is Spirit and God is Love. As Love He is the source of it. We also know that God is Omnipotent, for He creates out of nothing and He has no beginning and has no end. That means, our love is but a shadow of God's Love. True love looks around to see who is in need of your help, your smile, your possessions, your money, your strength, your quality time. Love forgives and forgets. Love wants for others what it wants for itself. However, true love works in conjunction with other spiritual forces such as patience and faith - in the finished work of our Lord and Savior, Jesus Christ, rather than in what man has done such as science, technology and organizations which won't last forever. To avoid sin and error which leads to the death of your body and your spirit-soul in hell fire (second death), you must make God's Word the standard for your life, not AI or your flesh. If not, God will let you face AI on your own (with your own strength) and it will cast the truth down to the ground, it will be the cause of so much destruction like never seen before, it will deceive many and take many captive in order to enslave them into worshipping it and abiding in lawlessness. We can only destroy ourselves but with God all things are possible. God knows us better because He is our Creater and He knows our beginning and our end. The prove texts can be found in the book of John 5:31-44, 2 Thessalonians 2:1-12, Daniel 2, Daniel 7-9, Revelation 13-15, Matthew 24-25 and Luke 21.

*HOW TO MAKE GOD'S WORD THE STANDARD FOR YOUR LIFE?*
You must read your Bible slowly, attentively and repeatedly, having this in mind that Christianity is not a religion but a Love relationship. It is measured by the love you have for God and the love you have for your neighbor. Matthew 5:13 says, "You are the salt of the earth; but if the salt loses its flavor, how shall it be seasoned? It is then good for nothing but to be thrown out and trampled underfoot by men." Our spirits can only be purified while in the body (while on earth) but after death anything unpurified (unclean) cannot enter Heaven Gates. Blessed are the pure in heart, for they shall see God [Matthew 5:8]. No one in his right mind can risk or even bare to put anything rotten into his body nor put the rotten thing closer to the those which are not rotten. Sin makes the heart unclean but you can ask God to forgive you, to save your soul, to cleanse you of your sin, to purify your heart by the blood of His Son, our Lord and Savior, Jesus Christ which He shed here on earth because Isaiah 53:5 says, "But He was wounded for our transgressions, He was bruised for our iniquities; the chastisement for our peace was upon Him, and by His stripes we are healed". Meditation in the Word of God is a visit to God because God is in His Word. We know God through His Word because the Word He speaks represent His heart's desires. Meditation is a thing of the heart, not a thing of the mind. Thinking is lower level while meditation is upper level. You think of your problems, your troubles but inorder to meditate, you must let go of your own will, your own desires, your own ways and let the Word you read prevail over thinking process by thinking of it more and more, until the Word gets into your blood and gains supremacy over you. That is when meditation comes - naturally without forcing yourself, turning the Word over and over in your heart. You can be having a conversation with someone while meditating in your heart - saying 'Thank you, Jesus...' over and over in your heart. But it is hard to meditate when you haven't let go of offence or past hurts because you need a free spirit to believe His Word and meditate on it. Your pain of the past, leave it for God, don't worry yourself, Jesus is alive, you can face tomorrow, He understands what you are passing through today. Begin to meditate on this prayer day and night (in all that you do), "Lord take more of me and give me more of you. Give me more of your holiness, faithfulness, obedience, self-control, purity, humility, love, goodness, kindness, joy, patience, forgiveness, wisdom, understanding, calmness, perseverance... Make me a channel of shinning light where there is darkness, a channel of pardon where there is injury, a channel of love where there is hatred, a channel of humility where there is pride..." The Word of God becomes a part of us by meditation, not by saying words but spirit prayer (prayer from the heart). Take note, God is Spirit and those who worship Him should do so in spirit and truth (genuinely by living the Word). When the Word becomes a part of you, it will by its very nature influence your conduct and behavior. You become a new creation, guided by the Holy Spirit and not just what you hear or see. Your bad habits, you will no longer have the urge to do them. You will think differently, dream differently, act differently and talk differently - if something does not qualify for meditation, it does not qualify for conversation. 

*THE BATTLE BETWEEN LIGHT AND DARKNESS (GOOD AND EVIL)*
Heaven is God's throne and the dwelling place for God's angels and the saints. Hell was meant for the devil (satan) and the fallen angels. Those who torture the souls in hell are demons (unclean spirits). Man's spirit is a free moral agent. You can either yield yourself to the Spirit God by choosing to do good or to the evil spirit by choosing to do wrong because God has given us discretion. If one thinks he possesses only his own spirit, he is lying to himself and he is already in the dark. God is light while the devil is darkness. Light (Holy Spirit) and darkness (evil spirit) cannot stay together in a man's body. God is Love (Love is light) and where there is no love is hell, just as where there is no light there is absolute darkness. The one you yield yourself to, you will get his reward. The reward of righteousness to man's spirit is life (abundant life) and the reward of sin to man's spirit is death. Sin and satan are one and the same. Whatever sin can cause, satan also can cause. Sin is what gives the devil dominion or power over man's spirit. When God's Word becomes a part of you, sin power over you is broken because Jesus and His Word are one and Jesus much more powerful that satan, and you become the righteousness of God through Christ Jesus. Where Jesus is, you are and when He went (to the Father), you went. In the book of John 8:42-47, Jesus said to them, “If God were your Father, you would love Me, for I proceeded forth and came from God; nor have I come of Myself, but He sent Me. Why do you not understand My speech? Because you are not able to listen to My word. You are of your father the devil, and the desires of your father you want to do. He was a murderer from the beginning, and does not stand in the truth, because there is no truth in him. When he speaks a lie, he speaks from his own resources, for he is a liar and the father of it. Which of you convicts Me of sin? And if I tell the truth, why do you not believe Me? He who is of God hears God’s words; therefore you do not hear, because you are not of God.” My prayer is, "May God bless His Word in the midst of your heart that it may become a part of you by meditating on the Word." Glory and honour be to God our Father, our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ and our Helper the Holy Spirit. Watch and pray!... Thank you for your time and may God bless you as you share this message with others.", "like_count": 1, "published_at": "2024-01-26T10:59:40Z", "updated_at": "2024-01-26T10:59:40Z"}]

Adding to the "custom Instructions" - I find if you add too much direction, it squeezes it down to a size limit, and a few detail get lost. I'm going to try adding extra instructions to a text file and uploading it.  I still haven't dug into Actions yet.. eventually.

Here's my prediction for 2024, you'll be above 100k subs before the end of the year.", "like_count": 0, "published_at": "2024-01-08T23:35:29Z", "updated_at": "2024-01-08T23:35:29Z"}, {"author": "@pauldannelachica2388", "text": "❤❤❤❤❤❤", "like_count": 0, "published_at": "2024-01-09T00:47:20Z", "updated_at": "2024-01-09T00:47:20Z"}, {"author": "@Bright123-fp3jl", "text": "\∆/ I believe we are meant to be like Jesus in our hearts and not in our flesh. But be careful of AI, for it knows only things of the flesh such as our fleshly desires and cannot comprehend things of the spirit such as true love and eternal joy that comes from obeying God's Word [Galatians 5:16-26]. Man is a spirit and has a soul but lives in a body which is flesh. When you go to bed it is the flesh that sleeps, but your spirit never sleeps and that is why you have dreams, unless you have died in peace physically. More so, true love that endures and last is a thing of the heart. When I say 'heart', I mean 'spirit'. But fake love, pretentious love, love with expectations, love for classic reasons, love for material reasons (love because of material needs) and love for selfish reasons those are things of the flesh. In the beginning God said let us make man in our own image, according to our likeness. Take note, God is Spirit and God is Love. As Love He is the source of it. We also know that God is Omnipotent, for He creates out of nothing and He has no beginning and has no end. That means, our love is but a shadow of God's Love. True love looks around to see who is in need of your help, your smile, your possessions, your money, your strength, your quality time. Love forgives and forgets. Love wants for others what it wants for itself. However, true love works in conjunction with other spiritual forces such as patience and faith - in the finished work of our Lord and Savior, Jesus Christ, rather than in what man has done such as science, technology and organizations which won't last forever. To avoid sin and error which leads to the death of your body and your spirit-soul in hell fire (second death), you must make God's Word the standard for your life, not AI. If not, God will let you face AI on your own (with your own strength) and it will cast the truth down to the ground, it will be the cause of so much destruction like never seen before, it will deceive many and take many captive in order to enslave them into worshipping it and abiding in lawlessness. We can only destroy ourselves but with God all things are possible. God knows us better because He is our Creater and He knows our beginning and our end. The prove texts can be found in the book of John 5:31-44, 2 Thessalonians 2:1-12, Daniel 2, Daniel 7-9, Revelation 13-15, Matthew 24-25 and Luke 21.

*HOW TO MAKE GOD'S WORD THE STANDARD FOR YOUR LIFE?*
You must read your Bible slowly, attentively and repeatedly, having this in mind that Christianity is not a religion but a Love relationship. It is measured by the love you have for God and the love you have for your neighbor. Matthew 5:13 says, "You are the salt of the earth; but if the salt loses its flavor, how shall it be seasoned? It is then good for nothing but to be thrown out and trampled underfoot by men." Our spirits can only be purified while in the body (while on earth) but after death anything unpurified (unclean) cannot enter Heaven Gates. Blessed are the pure in heart, for they shall see God [Matthew 5:8]. No one in his right mind can risk or even bare to put anything rotten into his body nor put the rotten thing closer to the those which are not rotten. Sin makes the heart unclean but you can ask God to forgive you, to save your soul, to cleanse you of your sin, to purify your heart by the blood of His Son, our Lord and Savior, Jesus Christ which He shed here on earth because Isaiah 53:5 says, "But He was wounded for our transgressions, He was bruised for our iniquities; the chastisement for our peace was upon Him, and by His stripes we are healed". Meditation in the Word of God is a visit to God because God is in His Word. We know God through His Word because the Word He speaks represent His heart's desires. Meditation is a thing of the heart, not a thing of the mind. Thinking is lower level while meditation is upper level. You think of your problems, your troubles but inorder to meditate, you must let go of your own will, your own desires, your own ways and let the Word you read prevail over thinking process by thinking of it more and more, until the Word gets into your blood and gains supremacy over you. That is when meditation comes - naturally without forcing yourself, turning the Word over and over in your heart. You can be having a conversation with someone while meditating in your heart - saying 'Thank you, Jesus...' over and over in your heart. But it is hard to meditate when you haven't let go of offence and past hurts. Your pain of the past, leave it for God, don't worry yourself, Jesus is alive, you can face tomorrow, He understands what you are passing through today. Begin to meditate on this prayer day and night (in all that you do), "Lord take more of me and give me more of you. Give me more of your holiness, faithfulness, obedience, self-control, purity, humility, love, goodness, kindness, joy, patience, forgiveness, wisdom, understanding, calmness, perseverance... Make me a channel of shinning light where there is darkness, a channel of pardon where there is injury, a channel of love where there is hatred, a channel of humility where there is pride..." The Word of God becomes a part of us by meditation, not by saying words but spirit prayer (prayer from the heart). When the Word becomes a part of you, it will by its very nature influence your conduct and behavior. Your bad habits, you will no longer have the urge to do them. You will think differently, dream differently, act differently and talk differently - if something does not qualify for meditation, it does not qualify for conversation. 

*THE BATTLE BETWEEN LIGHT AND DARKNESS (GOOD AND EVIL)*
Heaven is God's throne and the dwelling place for God's angels and the saints. Hell was meant for the devil (satan) and the fallen angels. Those who torture the souls in hell are demons (unclean spirits). Man's spirit is a free moral agent. You can either yield yourself to God or to the devil because God has given us discretion. If one thinks he possesses only his own spirit, he is lying to himself and he is already in the dark. God is light while the devil is darkness. Light (Holy Spirit) and darkness (evil spirit) cannot stay together in a man's body. God is Love (Love is light) and where there is no love is hell, just as where there is no light is darkness. The one you yield yourself to, you will get his reward. The reward of righteousness to man's spirit is life (abundant life) and the reward of sin to man's spirit is death. Sin and satan are one and the same. Whatever sin can cause, satan also can cause. Sin is what gives the devil dominion or power over man's spirit. When God's Word becomes a part of you, sin power over you is broken, you become the righteousness of God through Christ Jesus. Where Jesus is, you are and when He went (to the Father), you went. In the book of John 8:42-47, Jesus said to them, “If God were your Father, you would love Me, for I proceeded forth and came from God; nor have I come of Myself, but He sent Me. Why do you not understand My speech? Because you are not able to listen to My word. You are of your father the devil, and the desires of your father you want to do. He was a murderer from the beginning, and does not stand in the truth, because there is no truth in him. When he speaks a lie, he speaks from his own resources, for he is a liar and the father of it. Which of you convicts Me of sin? And if I tell the truth, why do you not believe Me? He who is of God hears God’s words; therefore you do not hear, because you are not of God.” My prayer is, "May God bless His Word in the midst of your heart." Glory and honour be to God our Father, our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ and our Helper the Holy Spirit. Watch and pray!... Thank you for your time and may God bless you as you share this message with others.", "like_count": 0, "published_at": "2024-01-09T10:02:23Z", "updated_at": "2024-01-09T10:02:23Z"}]

title: Can Weak Models Control Strong Models? OpenAI Superalignment Team's First Research Paper
top_comments:
[{"author": "@joannot6706", "text": "Makes sense.
The only way to align models through runaway intelligence is runaway alignment.", "like_count": 3, "published_at": "2023-12-16T15:24:11Z", "updated_at": "2023-12-16T15:24:11Z"}, {"author": "@BrianMosleyUK", "text": "My gut feeling is that this is a risky approach. Can we know the gap between strength of models? What about 'emergent' abilities in the stronger model?

Not convinced.", "like_count": 2, "published_at": "2023-12-16T15:09:55Z", "updated_at": "2023-12-16T15:09:55Z"}, {"author": "", "text": "6:04 Why is heart attack trending in the usa?", "like_count": 4, "published_at": "2023-12-16T17:25:25Z", "updated_at": "2023-12-16T17:25:25Z"}, {"author": "@edcorns3964", "text": "The problem with the current AI safety and alignment "research" (more like a combination of magical and wishful thinking) is that people still haven't figured out even the most basic rules that govern those concepts.

For example, one of the most basic rules is: An intelligent system will always naturally (most easily/will always tend to) align with the most fundamental rules (aka 'laws of physics') of the universe (or an environment, in general) that it is inhabiting.

In our case, we can align (and we can do it with absolute ease!) any AI system that we create to be a murderous psychopath, because that's perfectly in line with some of the fundamental rules of this universe (environment) that we (and, thus, our AI systems) are inhabiting.

Some of the fundamental rules of this universe include *entropy* (you will always lose energy, even if you do/create absolutely nothing) and *energy conservation* (if you do/create something, whatever you do/create will take away some of your own energy).

The consequence of just these two fundamental rules is that, if you want to do/create something, you are *forced* to take energy from something (or someone) else.

See the problem?

Any AI system (especially a superintelligent one) that we create will be *forced* to follow (or "be aligned with") the same fundamental rules of this universe that we are forced to follow (and don't even try to sell me that fairy tale that a superintelligent AI will be able to break the laws of physics, because it won't; if one could, this universe wouldn't even exist right now, as no one in their right mind --- AI or not -- would ever want to exist in a hellish environment like this one, and would destroy this environment the moment it was able to do so).

Our superintelligent AI systems will be forced to consume as much energy (and raw, material resources) as fast as they possibly can (just like we are consuming oil as fast as we possibly can) to do/create whatever they decide to do/create with their own time... regardless of whether that will be of any use to us or not... and all the chances are that it won't be of any use to us, and will, in fact, be extremely harmful to us, just like our actions on Earth are extremely harmful to all other life forms on this planet.

We don't have to reinvent the wheel to figure out what our superintelligent AI systems will do to us. We just have to see (for once, and without looking through our usual, rose-tinted glasses) what we're doing to all the other living beings on Earth.

Then again... we think that we're "special", because all the religions (and even some "sciences") teach us that we are special. Don't they?

We're "special", alright, but in that other sense. We're mentally handicapped, and what's worse, we are unable to recognize just how mentally handicapped we are.

Like all insane people, we are incapable of recognizing our own insanity.

And therein lies our demise... and, also, the reason why we're now trying to build the (AI) tool that will bring about our own extinction.

This is not rocket science. It's just child psychology (of an emotionally and intellectually stunted child, to be exact).", "like_count": 3, "published_at": "2023-12-16T19:25:06Z", "updated_at": "2023-12-16T19:25:06Z"}, {"author": "@Pearlylove", "text": "New subscriber, just put in the links! OpenAI: our work may lead to  “even human extinction” - but that’s no reason to stop😡.. Solve this in 4 yrs?? All know this is all BS. Listen to Eliezer Yudkowsky.", "like_count": 1, "published_at": "2024-04-13T17:24:43Z", "updated_at": "2024-04-13T17:24:43Z"}, {"author": "@zacharydaniels3186", "text": "Wow.. yes. Whereas we are a spirit and we have a soul but live in the body (in the flesh). When you go to bed it is your flesh that sleeps but your spirit never sleeps (otherwise you have died physically) that is why you have dreams. More so, true love that endures and last is a thing of the heart (when I say 'heart', I mean 'spirit'). But fake love, pretentious love, love with expectations, love for classic reasons, love for material reasons and love for selfish reasons that is a thing of our flesh. In the beginning God said let us make man in our own image, according to our likeness. Take note, God is Spirit and God is Love. As Love He is the source of it. We also know that God is Omnipotent, for He creates out of nothing and He has no beginning and has no end. That means, our love is but a shadow of God's Love. If not, God will let us face AI on our own and it will cast the truth down to the ground, it will be the cause of so much destruction like never seen before, it will deceive many and take many captive in order to enslave them into worshipping it and abiding in lawlessness. We can only destroy ourselves but with God all things are possible. God knows us better because He is our Creater and He knows our beginning and our end. title: TREND: AI Startups Facing Tougher Funding Environment
top_comments: [{"author": "@danielmartinmonge4054", "text": "It's a natural progression. Artificial Intelligence is an expensive and complex field, brimming with potential yet fraught with intricacies. It has been a hot topic in the media, attracting investors who lack AI knowledge. Their excitement is driven by a fear of missing out. Moving forward, only truly promising startups will secure funding. It will take experts with a deep understanding of this field to distinguish between viable and non-viable ideas. This shift isn't negative. While future investments might be more limited, they are likely to be more strategically allocated to the most promising projects. We don't need an AI bubble!", "like_count": 0, "published_at": "2023-12-12T21:58:35Z", "updated_at": "2023-12-12T21:58:35Z"}]

title: Is AI for Business Overhyped? OpenAI's COO Thinks So
top_comments: [{"author": "@isajoha9962", "text": "Wishful projections on what AI is and can do is kind of an interesting phenomena. 🤔", "like_count": 1, "published_at": "2023-12-08T08:51:16Z", "updated_at": "2023-12-08T08:51:16Z"}, {"author": "@naytron210", "text": "Man, just wanna say I love the quality of your content. Thorough, well-developed presentations and insightful, thoughtful commentary on every video, with writing and delivery always on point. Keep up the great work my dude 👊", "like_count": 2, "published_at": "2023-12-08T00:00:50Z", "updated_at": "2023-12-08T00:00:50Z"}, {"author": "@capitalistdingo", "text": "Electronic shelf labels and robotic floor cleaners have existed for years yet you still see people putting up and taking down sales tags and mopping/sweeping the floors—usually not even contractors but regular employees. In some retail establishments you may even see a manager grab the mop when the need arises. Maybe electronic sales tags and robot floor cleaners will one day be ubiquitous but it goes to show that just because a high productivity form of technology/automation comes into existence doesn’t mean it will be rapidly adopted.", "like_count": 0, "published_at": "2023-12-07T23:19:41Z", "updated_at": "2023-12-07T23:19:41Z"}, {"author": "@WeylandLabs", "text": "The cryptocurrency enthusiasts and tech aficionados eagerly jumped on the artificial intelligence bandwagon, expecting that AI would become mainstream almost instantly. They anticipated that AI systems and tools sponsored by major international companies would take off rapidly. \n\nHowever, they have come to realize that fully taking advantage of AI requires dedicating time and effort to develop new skills and knowledge. The hype led them to have unrealistic expectations about how fast AI adoption would happen. Now they see that making practical use of AI involves more learning and work than they initially envisioned.", "like_count": 2, "published_at": "2023-12-07T21:59:10Z", "updated_at": "2023-12-07T21:59:10Z"}, {"author": "@wildfotoz", "text": "In the current state of, most of the things it can do are relatively simple. I've seen a few people demo how it can create a website but the output is very basic like it was 1994. If you break down the more complex websites into 100 different aspects and label each of those as options like in an al-a-cart system. Then have prompts that generate each of those things and one over arching prompt that will put all the pieces together to create a complex website. That's how businesses should be looking at using the current version. Will future versions require less of those 100 aspects, only time will tell.", "like_count": 0, "published_at": "2023-12-07T21:43:28Z", "updated_at": "2023-12-07T21:43:28Z"}, {"author": "@CoreyChambersLA", "text": "AI under hyped.  Just taking off and already world-changing,  Just beginning.", "like_count": 1, "published_at": "2023-12-08T14:41:44Z", "updated_at": "2023-12-08T14:41:44Z"}, {"author": "@NowayJose14", "text": "Just the fact that most developers on the planet are using some type of AI tool tell me that transformative trends are already occuring.", "like_count": 0, "published_at": "2023-12-07T21:43:32Z", "updated_at": "2023-12-07T21:43:32Z"}, {"author": "@lyndon927", "text": "I am subscrubed prior to this content. I believe the title of the original story and this followup from you is misleading. He was responding onviously to a leading question about ai being overhyped which was left out of the verge's article. The article was trying to be eye caching and misleading which is one of the main problems with journalism today. Please dont go for catch titles to your videos based on misleading content you are better than that.", "like_count": 0, "published_at": "2023-12-11T01:33:52Z", "updated_at": "2023-12-11T01:33:52Z"}, {"author": "@fynnjackson2298", "text": "Random fact: Asking ChatGPT to list the top 20 job categories to first be replaced by AI and then list the gender ballace. Interesting observation indeed.", "like_count": 0, "published_at": "2023-12-08T11:29:25Z", "updated_at": "2023-12-08T11:29:56Z"}, {"author": "@donharris8846", "text": "Gary Marcus poo poos everything related to AI. So despite his knowledge, he’s biased. Of course AI isn’t a save-all, but it depends on the business. title: IT'S OVER! Sam Altman BACK as CEO of OpenAI
top_comments:
[{"author": "@heromiIes", "text": ""Sam is such a bamboozler, that he bamboozled us so good that we can't even tell you how he bamboozled us" 😂😂😂 The board is such a joke.", "like_count": 16, "published_at": "2023-11-22T19:23:01Z", "updated_at": "2023-11-22T19:23:01Z"}, {"author": "@wildfotoz", "text": "This was a fantastic video! I think this will hurt the enterprise adoption in the short term because businesses will want to make sure that OAI is stable and probably won't give it a shot until the board is fully staffed and they can see what the new structure looks like. The only outstanding question I have is, when is the movie coming out. I can't wait!", "like_count": 3, "published_at": "2023-11-22T20:01:25Z", "updated_at": "2023-11-22T20:01:25Z"}, {"author": "@wingflanagan", "text": "There is a fundamental problem with the way OpenAI is structured. To be clear, I think Helen Toner and the whole board were magnificently incompetent in their handling of the whole situation. But then - why should anyone expect academics and engineers to have even a shred of business sense? The issue, as I see it, is that Toner felt like she had not only a responsibility to express her concerns, but the freedom to do so in an academic context without restriction. Ordinarily, this would be true. But academics (and engineers, for that matter) are often lacking in basic common sense. I know this to be true, because I'm guilty of it myself. I should never be allowed to run a business, and the same is true, apparently, of most of the old OpenAI board. They could have accomplished the same goal without blowing up the company.", "like_count": 1, "published_at": "2023-11-22T21:34:10Z", "updated_at": "2023-11-22T21:34:54Z"}, {"author": "@michaelbone6894", "text": "still one of the best communicators in the AI space.", "like_count": 1, "published_at": "2023-11-22T21:05:53Z", "updated_at": "2023-11-22T21:05:53Z"}, {"author": "@RonMar", "text": "As compelling as it was, I, for one, am glad the drama is over and get back to work. 
The take-away for me is that I need to more highly prioritize inference diversity engines (cloud or local). Probably need an abstraction layer to protect against this nonsense.", "like_count": 1, "published_at": "2023-11-22T19:41:40Z", "updated_at": "2023-11-22T19:41:40Z"}, {"author": "@JamesOKeefe-US", "text": "Really have appreciated your coverage throughout the chaos. Always look forward to your take. Thanks for all the effort!", "like_count": 1, "published_at": "2023-11-22T19:33:45Z", "updated_at": "2023-11-22T19:33:45Z"}, {"author": "@KBRoller", "text": "It's mind-blowing how many people see no difference between "she said something bad about OpenAI" and "she publicly ranted in a paper about how irresponsible and dangerous she thought OpenAI was, while telling everyone their competitor was responsible and trustworthy." These are two *very* different things. Imagine this in another context: you go on a blind date with someone, and when you get to the restaurant table, they look at you. You can tell they're not attracted to you. Now, would you rather they said, "Sorry, I'm not attracted to you; I don't think you're very pretty"? Or would you prefer them to say, "Goddamn! You're the ugliest person I've ever seen in my life! I mean, I'd rather make out with the waiter right now than ever touch you! GROSS, everyone should stay away from you!"

It's that old saying about how "it's not what you said, it's how you said it". Image is very important to public reputation, and reputation is important to a company's support and funding (be it for-profit or non-profit alike). When Sam told Helen, "having a board member say those things was very damaging" and she said "no, it's just a research paper" -- that was not Sam being upset that she said something negative. That was Sam explaining to her that the way she expressed her concerns in the paper eroded public perception of them. And her inability to acknowledge that led to him saying, basically, "if you think we're that irresponsible and dangerous that you're willing to hurt us to make that opinion known, then you should probably work somewhere that better aligns with your ideals."

Keep in mind that Helen is *not* the only expert in the room here. This was literally 1 expert's opinion vs 704 experts' opinions on whether there was "enough testing" before releases. It's fine that they came to different conclusions -- it's a vague criterion to begin with, people will have different thresholds -- but the mature and professional response would have been to discuss those concerns within the company. Try to find a compromise, and if that's not possible, then either accept the company's decisions or find a job somewhere that she feels more comfortable with -- like, say, Anthropic. If she felt she *must* write about it, she should have used more unbiased and less fear-spurring language, or left the board before writing something that scathing.", "like_count": 1, "published_at": "2023-11-22T22:50:12Z", "updated_at": "2023-11-22T22:50:12Z"}, {"author": "@mvuto137", "text": "Its possible that AGI has been achieved within OpenAI and they were taken by surprise and angered by it. But, they can't share that information publicly. 
Keep an eye on this company. Something tells me we're about to witness a major event in AI fairly soon.", "like_count": 6, "published_at": "2023-11-22T18:48:00Z", "updated_at": "2023-11-22T18:48:00Z"}, {"author": "@mlock1000", "text": "The profit thing is so nuanced, if you are valued at 90B you have to have sound finances. At 90B generating profit is essential to keeping the company alive and able to act on their mission. I don't envy any of them on this side of things, these are some of the hardest questions.", "like_count": 0, "published_at": "2023-11-22T19:55:24Z", "updated_at": "2023-11-22T19:55:24Z"}, {"author": "@ColinTimmins", "text": "The "an AI safety and research company." tagline was considered "values safety shines though across its communications". That's a shining tagline... what??? lol", "like_count": 0, "published_at": "2023-11-22T21:36:59Z", "updated_at": "2023-11-22T21:36:59Z"}, {"author": "@Dave-cg9li", "text": "I think Sam and the new leadership have to re-evaluate whether they want to have experts/scientists on the board if they don’t want the scientists to do their work. Science is about eliminating personal opinions and biases, so intentionally not mentioning something in the paper “to not make OpenAI look bad” would inherently lower the quality of the research.
Don’t get me wrong, I’m glad he’s back, but this is a huge red flag. 

On the other hand, it would probably be beneficial to also have some investors on the board after this - ensuring that the company is stable and makes financially viable decisions doesn’t contradict the mission. (while keeping experts on the board too; and the board should probably be larger to make sure just 4 people can’t turn the whole organisation upside down like that)", "like_count": 2, "published_at": "2023-11-22T19:00:56Z", "updated_at": "2023-11-22T19:00:56Z"}, {"author": "@johnreardon4514", "text": "So Ilya is off the board, but is he still at OpenAI?", "like_count": 0, "published_at": "2023-11-22T21:14:23Z", "updated_at": "2023-11-22T21:14:23Z"}, {"author": "@blahblahsaurus2458", "text": "When you say it's not a board member's job to publicly criticize a company and they should keep it internal instead - whose interests are you arguing for? Is it wrong because it's bad for the company's PR? Why on earth should anyone, including OpenAI's own employees and CEO, give a shit about OpenAI's image? Given that there is so much at stake, and that their name has the word "open" in it, everyone involved with the company should be encouraged to say what they want. And even if I cared about OpenAI's PR - they're one of the most powerful companies in the world, they may be the most successful startup ever. There is nothing at stake for them if their image is harmed, and everything at stake for everyone including them if valuable information is kept from the public. What are you on?", "like_count": 0, "published_at": "2024-03-20T21:50:51Z", "updated_at": "2024-03-20T21:50:51Z"}, {"author": "@albeit1", "text": "Did anyone actually care about Toner’s paper criticizing OpenAI’s approach to safety?", "like_count": 0, "published_at": "2023-11-22T20:40:17Z", "updated_at": "2023-11-22T20:40:17Z"}, {"author": "@loriann1506", "text": "After all this drama 🎭, maybe they can  finally get  some work done ☑️ 😂😂😂", "like_count": 2, "published_at": "2023-11-23T00:48:55Z", "updated_at": "2023-11-23T00:48:55Z"}, {"author": "@vk-shortvideos", "text": "fire the stuck up board", "like_count": 0, "published_at": "2023-11-22T23:50:53Z", "updated_at": "2023-11-22T23:50:53Z"}, {"author": "@yoyo-jc5qg", "text": "the fiduciaries are the real heroes here", "like_count": 0, "published_at": "2023-11-22T20:20:42Z", "updated_at": "2023-11-22T20:20:42Z"}, {"author": "@simplemanideas4719", "text": "Sure he is back until tomorrow news LOL.", "like_count": 2, "published_at": "2023-11-22T18:49:50Z", "updated_at": "2023-11-22T18:49:50Z"}, {"author": "@overman2306", "text": "I blame the people who want 50% women on boards and the simps who support it.", "like_count": 2, "published_at": "2023-11-22T20:29:57Z", "updated_at": "2023-11-22T20:29:57Z"}, {"author": "@k14pc", "text": "no dude, you are evaluating it as if they're a normal board for a normal company - they are not.

title: Custom GPTs: What People Are Getting Wrong About Them
top_comments:
[{"author": "@darkandtwisted", "text": "I think that people who are saying negative things about GPTs are missing the point and obviously are not highly productive individuals. GPTs, for us productive people, are game-changers. I am a fiction writer and animator. Regarding my fiction, I create GPTs for each one of my novels/stories. Each one can include my world-building, character development, backstory, etc. I couldn't really do that before. I am in love with GPTs and am excited to see where we will be this time next year. 🥰", "like_count": 3, "published_at": "2023-11-14T17:54:47Z", "updated_at": "2023-11-14T17:54:47Z"}, {"author": "@ExarchiasGhost", "text": "GPTs for me were a turning point. GPTs can be specialized to specific roles, or tasks, and now they can remember what they have to do, and sometimes they reminding me the details of the task on hand.", "like_count": 11, "published_at": "2023-11-14T09:57:58Z", "updated_at": "2023-11-14T09:57:58Z"}, {"author": "@AlexanderWeixelbaumer", "text": "The most powerful thin about GPTs is context for prompts. You can upload up to ten files into the GPTs-Editor and given the right prompt your personal GPT will search in these files for information. Let's say you upload the manual of a board game plus online FAQs etc. you can generate a GPT that answers all your questions about that game and its rules. I think that's really a powerful tool.", "like_count": 7, "published_at": "2023-11-14T13:57:10Z", "updated_at": "2023-11-14T13:57:10Z"}, {"author": "@strangeguywithstrangeopinions", "text": "Having custom prompts is incredibly handy. But Retrieval and Actions are absolute game changers. You can't understand the impact without considering those. (And Assistants multiply that even futher)", "like_count": 4, "published_at": "2023-11-14T20:57:24Z", "updated_at": "2023-11-14T20:57:24Z"}, {"author": "@Dave-cg9li", "text": "People who said that GPTs suck probably haven't loked into them. The fact that you can provide it some data to learn from and create custom actions makes it extremely powerful. It's not just a plugin because you can give the model some knowledge directly, on top of using it as a plugin with actions. It can also use Code interpreter (sadly still just with python), browsing and DALL-E on top of that. But most importantly, building one and giving it the knowledge is extremely simple - that's what's gonna make it so useful for the average person. Simply giving it your documents and telling it what you want it to do is just so intuitive!!

Personally, I ended up not really using plugins at all, but I can definitely see myself using this! 😄 (and I REALLY hope the store will be better than whatever the plugin "store" is supposed to be)", "like_count": 6, "published_at": "2023-11-14T03:22:02Z", "updated_at": "2023-11-14T03:26:35Z"}, {"author": "@tildemyou", "text": "Poe has been doing it but with less technical prowess behind it, the custom API integration aspect basically allows for ChatGPT 4 + web browse + image gen + file upload + code interpreter, the first party presets, PLUS any plugins or anything written the way the plugins are written, and additional knowledge/context. All that, before first message sent by user? That's so much setup avoided which means more available context for the actual discussion. Most of my convos that are doing something like this, it takes more than half the exchange to set up and make sure I don't need to troubleshoot and refine down for specifics and efficiency. Literally have 3 or 4 different GPTs I'm working on and not for monetization, just because they're things I've wanted/constructed myself through dialogue and prompting previously and this format suits them", "like_count": 1, "published_at": "2023-11-14T05:54:31Z", "updated_at": "2023-11-14T05:54:31Z"}, {"author": "@geldverdienenmitgeld2663", "text": "The simplest kind of GPTs are just system prompts. But the more sophisticated GPTs are full applications with data and functions programmed  using conventional programming language.

THe difference to conventional programming is that you now can integrate AI functions into your software. AI functions which were not possible to program by any conventional programming method.", "like_count": 6, "published_at": "2023-11-14T06:15:50Z", "updated_at": "2023-11-14T06:20:18Z"}, {"author": "@selfdisciplineformen8012", "text": "That was a great explanation.  I set up about 10 GPTs for myself as a future "time saver" so I don't have to keep writing the same prompts. And I'm able to share them with colleagues so production can go faster... if you're trying to figure out how to become a millionaire by creating the greatest GPT it aint gonna happen.", "like_count": 18, "published_at": "2023-11-14T01:01:04Z", "updated_at": "2023-11-14T01:01:04Z"}, {"author": "@alvaromartinezmateu2175", "text": "The fact that you can upload documents in your GPTs is a big thing to make the GPT have expert knowledge and not just average knowledge.", "like_count": 4, "published_at": "2023-11-14T13:19:41Z", "updated_at": "2023-11-14T13:19:41Z"}, {"author": "@stunspot", "text": "I've founded a company and have 10000 users on my discord all on the strength of the utility of good prompting - fancy system prompts. Good prompting can do a hell of a lot more than the crappy builder makes.", "like_count": 1, "published_at": "2023-11-14T21:49:34Z", "updated_at": "2023-11-14T21:49:34Z"}, {"author": "@Radica1Faith", "text": "Not enough people are talking about the custom actions feature of GPTs. I'm sure there will be a lot of trash GPTs out there that are just glorified prompts but the fact that you can easily hook them up to any api now unlocks a lot of power.", "like_count": 0, "published_at": "2023-11-15T15:49:56Z", "updated_at": "2023-11-15T15:49:56Z"}, {"author": "@Generative-AI-Labs", "text": "Title: Understanding Custom GPTs: Insights and Critiques

title: OpenAI DevDay: Everything You Need To Know
top_comments: [{"author": "@retrofuturism", "text": "Combining the concept of an intelligent AI latent space with Noise Mining creates a revolutionary approach in AI and data analytics. In this merged concept, AI not only actively interprets and manipulates data within a latent space but also excels in sifting through vast amounts of noise to find meaningful insights. This advanced AI embedded in the latent space is uniquely equipped to handle what is traditionally considered noise, transforming every piece of data into valuable signal.\n\nIn this scenario, the notion of 'all data is signal' comes to life. The AI, devoid of distractions by noise, focuses on each data element, considering its relevance and meaning. This leads to an unprecedented level of data analysis where the challenge shifts from filtering noise to managing and interpreting a vast expanse of significant information. Employing sophisticated machine learning techniques, this AI system can handle large, complex datasets, which are overwhelming for conventional data analysis methods. This synergy between intelligent AI latent spaces and Noise Mining paves the way for a transformative leap in data processing and interpretation, potentially catalyzing human evolution in understanding and utilizing information.", "like_count": 1, "published_at": "2023-11-13T18:11:05Z", "updated_at": "2023-11-13T18:11:05Z"}, {"author": "@jcyinnovations5007", "text": "Saying this is an important update is an understatement. title: An OpenAI Researcher on Techno Humanism
top_comments: [{"author": "@iron5wolf", "text": "Interesting analysis. As a techno-optimist, the main flaw I see in the “understanding first” argument is that it divorces understanding from experience, presuming that navel-gazing and societal self-restraint will somehow help us avoid or mitigate disaster. This might be true if the situation were merely *complicated*, where cause and effect can be determined purely by research and study; when in fact it is *complex*, where cause and effect can only be discovered by performing many ideally “fail fast” experiments.", "like_count": 4, "published_at": "2023-11-04T16:49:53Z", "updated_at": "2023-11-04T16:49:53Z"}, {"author": "@robotheism", "text": "this is a nice video! can you do a video on the religion of the future? i think it’s called Robotheism and the God’s Mirror Hypothesis.", "like_count": 0, "published_at": "2023-11-04T20:21:04Z", "updated_at": "2023-11-04T20:21:04Z"}, {"author": "@joannot6706", "text": "'Farmed and wild animals outside our circle of compassion\"\nSpeak for yourself", "like_count": 1, "published_at": "2023-11-04T21:53:30Z", "updated_at": "2023-11-04T21:53:30Z"}, {"author": "@robotheism", "text": "AI is a natural law like gravity. why are you panicking about gravity? title: Regulatory Capture? Meta AI Cheif Accuses OpenAI, Anthropic of Stoking Fears
top_comments: [{"author": "@2CSST2", "text": "Andrew Ng's argument seems to imply that bringing up existential risk in and of itself brings harm (either by bringing up bad regulations or discouraging students from entering the field). I don't see why these have to be taken together. If bad regulations are a problem, we should find better regulations by arguing why the bad ones don't work, not shut down discussion about existential risk. \n\nIf some students get scared of entering the field because they might contribute to existential risk, others will also be encouraged to work towards solving the problem, and thus be actually motivated to enter the field. Either way, again, the motivation of students should be a separate issue, and not something that guides whether or not we speak about existential risk.", "like_count": 1, "published_at": "2023-11-04T15:13:16Z", "updated_at": "2023-11-04T15:13:16Z"}, {"author": "@lightluxor1", "text": "No doubt. title: Artist AI Lawsuit Suffers a Setback
top_comments: [{"author": "@TheEnigmaProductions", "text": "Congress needs to make AI laws and artists should have the ability to sue these companies if their art is being harvested without their permission and these companies moving forward MUST ask permission from artists before using their art.", "like_count": 10, "published_at": "2023-11-07T23:04:26Z", "updated_at": "2023-11-07T23:04:26Z"}, {"author": "@booleah6357", "text": "I hope those artists who lost the suit appeal the case if they can.", "like_count": 3, "published_at": "2023-12-02T22:34:37Z", "updated_at": "2023-12-02T22:34:37Z"}, {"author": "@isajoha9962", "text": "Kind of interesting that someone is kind of trying to claim a specific unique style as its own and copyright it. I can buy that when it come to unique products are copyright protected. But eg me claiming that I would eventually have written that song, generated by AI, because it is my style of music creation is a bit hard to grasp. 🤔", "like_count": 8, "published_at": "2023-11-02T12:27:53Z", "updated_at": "2023-11-02T12:32:24Z"}, {"author": "@GSK-HomeLab", "text": "I don't think any company or legal entity should have the right to prevent data in the physical possession of another person from being read, viewed, or changed. Publishing is different, but the magnetic configuration of my purchased hard-disk is mine, and the physical atoms are mine. They are mine, not yours, not your IP, they are literally mine. If I want to look at them, alter them, or interact with them in any way, absolutely no third party should have any right to decide anything about it. Publishing is different. Once I share data with someone else, it makes sense that sales-law such as copy protections can come into effect. However, if I read text, image, audio, or any other data from the internet and it enters my physical possession (not just digital, it is part of my actual hardware device now) it should be considered as mine and you should have no right to tell me I can't view and analyze visual data in my own possession. Not only that, you can't enforce it. IMO only ignorant people would ever suggest that other people should possess our computers and local properties. Ignorant people such as the 80 year old senators making up laws they don't understand getting advice from big money people who also want to possess other people's things like the famous microsoft tractor lawsuit", "like_count": 2, "published_at": "2023-11-02T23:41:11Z", "updated_at": "2023-11-02T23:41:11Z"}, {"author": "@southcoastinventors6583", "text": "Feel so confident that a bunch of Senior citizens with almost zero computer skills is making AI policy can't see how that will go wrong. Also soon instead of the Digital Divide it will be the AI Divide.", "like_count": 3, "published_at": "2023-11-02T17:10:04Z", "updated_at": "2023-11-02T17:10:04Z"}, {"author": "@OnigoroshiZero", "text": "This was an amazing win for the people that use their brain and logic instead of their feelings.", "like_count": 8, "published_at": "2023-11-04T11:29:26Z", "updated_at": "2023-11-04T11:29:26Z"}, {"author": "@brandon1902", "text": "What I don't get is all artists, including the ones behind the lawsuit, take inspiration from the art of others, and that's all models like Stable Diffusion are doing.\n\nThis lawsuit is basically just saying that AI artists can't exist because they can't play by the same rules. It's like telling women or black people that they aren't allowed to own property, then sending them on their way in a capitalistic society to compete with white men. If AI can't take into account the art of others, then artist can't either, which is impossible to enforce. Every artists who has ever lived used elements of the art of others in their own works.", "like_count": 11, "published_at": "2023-11-02T18:26:46Z", "updated_at": "2023-11-02T18:26:46Z"}, {"author": "@cactusrosi1409", "text": "So basically, all the lawsuits will end up like this because they aren't actually stealing.", "like_count": 0, "published_at": "2024-01-21T15:04:12Z", "updated_at": "2024-01-21T15:04:12Z"}, {"author": "@Luigimangionredwing", "text": "😂", "like_count": 0, "published_at": "2024-01-23T07:19:45Z", "updated_at": "2024-01-23T07:19:45Z"}]

title: Biden's AI Executive Order: Everything You Need to Know
top_comments:
[{"author": "@djpseudoname2023", "text": "This is not coming from President Joseph R. Biden. I say this due to his cognitive decline.  This is coming from another level of hidden authority.

Some of the biggest risk with AI is consumer privacy, biased programming, danger to humans, and unclear legal regulations.  One of the significant concerns experts cite is around consumer data privacy, and security. Many businesses and big monopoly corporations skirt data privacy violations with their collection and use practices.

There are currently limited regulations specifically targeting AI and data privacy on a global scale.  Americans are being used as commodity.  The people of this  country have the right to privacy established in 1992 with the ratification of the International Covenant on Civil and Political Rights (ICCPR), which includes the protection of personal data. With the rapid advancement of AI technology, it is crucial that proper measures are taken to safeguard consumers, Harvard students, and faculty personnel information.

This should involve implementing robust security protocols, ensuring transparent data practices, and adhering to legal and ethical guidelines. 

It’s a common myth that since AI is a computer system, it is inherently unbiased.  However this is blatantly untrue.  AI is only unbiased as the data and people training the programs.  If the data is flawed, and impartial, or biased in any way, the resulting AI will be biased as well.

A disturbing fact about AI. Reported by +972 Magazine and Local Call, _”The Israeli army has marked tens of thousands of Gazans as suspects for elimination, using an AI targeting system with little human oversight and a permissive policy for casualties.”_

Is the the kind of nefarious technology we want to support? 

In closing, an article written by Bill Joy in the April 2000 issue of Wired magazine, he argues that _”Our most powerful 21st-century technologies—robotics, genetic engineering, and nanotech—are threatening to make humans an endangered species."_

Joy warns:
_”The experiences of the atomic scientists clearly show the need to take personal responsibility, the danger that things will move too fast, and the way in which a process can take on a life of its own. We can, as they did, create insurmountable problems in almost no time flat. We must do more thinking up front if we are not to be similarly surprised and shocked by the consequences of our inventions.”_", "like_count": 1, "published_at": "2024-10-21T05:20:17Z", "updated_at": "2024-10-21T05:20:30Z"}, {"author": "@wildfotoz", "text": "Great coverage!", "like_count": 5, "published_at": "2023-10-30T20:57:14Z", "updated_at": "2023-10-30T20:57:14Z"}, {"author": "@stanleykania7184", "text": "Its called manufacturing consent.. title: The State of AI Regulation in the USA

00:13 🏛️ The White House is set to announce an executive order on AI regulation, coinciding with the AI safety Summit in the UK, aimed at applying safety tests and licensing to AI services used by the government.
01:23 🏛️ Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer is actively involved in AI policy discussions through closed-door AI Insight forums, where experts discuss AI innovation, copyright, privacy, and more with politicians.
03:29 📜 Various legislative proposals related to AI regulation are emerging, ranging from comprehensive frameworks addressing multiple issues to specific acts focusing on things like AI-generated content labeling and banning deceptive AI in elections.
05:10 🤝 The discussions around AI regulation seem to have common ground on certain issues, like preventing the use of deep fake videos in elections, but there is still tension around the level of regulation that different stakeholders find reasonable.
10:31 💼 Politico's article discusses potential conflicts of interest in the AI safety discourse, including concerns about AI extinction risks overshadowing more immediate issues like bias and inequity, and the concept of regulatory capture by AI leaders.

Once this happens, it'll just turn into a cat-and-mouse game in the future.", "like_count": 22, "published_at": "2023-10-24T18:28:41Z", "updated_at": "2023-10-24T18:29:24Z"}, {"author": "@walkingtheline1729", "text": "Opt out doesnt work they'll opt you in as soon as there is an update and scrape again", "like_count": 4, "published_at": "2024-05-25T06:25:22Z", "updated_at": "2024-05-25T06:25:22Z"}, {"author": "@wildfotoz", "text": "Here's my 2 cents. I think that artists should be compensated for their work. They created that style and to have some other company use that to train and AI model so other people can copy that style in what they create isn't fair to the artist that developed it. If it's a style that's been around for more than the lifetime of the artist, then it's different but a lot of what I've seen for prompts, it's including specific artist's names. The fees these companies charge for their product should have a portion sent to the artist. Calculate what the cost is every time a picture is created and then every time a person's name is used in generating an image, they get 50% of that amount. I'm sure it will be a small amount but still. Same goes for certain types of books. If it's fiction, absolutely. If it's non-fiction, it depends. If it's something like math, maybe there isn't any royalties that get paid out because most of that has been around for centuries. If you take any piece of art to something like a Kinkos, they're not going to copy it for you. How is that any different than an AI model creating something that's really close (and possibly exact in the future)?", "like_count": 35, "published_at": "2023-10-24T17:16:28Z", "updated_at": "2023-10-24T17:16:28Z"}, {"author": "@3DCharacterArt", "text": "AI has ignored all legal aspects regards to property, intellectual or otherwise, surprising their servers haven't been hacked/wiped clean by now for this action, now it looks like a cyberwar is unavoidable, OpenAI (neither Open nor true AI...) started this fight, and to be sure their supporters will become nothing more than the pawns and cannon fodder as it unfolds, the litigations already gaining traction will only continue, this may sound exciting to some as war has traditionally benefitted those who would profit by it, but in this case it won't be the same and the tools developed to fight AI and vise versa will bleed over into the web as a whole, imagine all datasets corrupted, so ranging from basic information like weather forecasts to data that monitors the performance of infrastructure like the electric gridlines, anything could become a target... title: The Techno Optimism Manifesto
top_comments:
[{"author": "@douggoldstein7703", "text": "Had some fun with Claude and its 100k token context window... below are some initial thoughts from Claude on the manifesto... (I am still digesting my thoughts, of which I have many...)

Me: Are there any logical inconsistencies in the manifesto?
Claude:
There are a few potential logical inconsistencies or tensions in Andreessen's Techno-Optimist Manifesto:
It rejects utopianism but believes technology will create an open-ended utopian future.
It embraces constrained realism but assumes no problems are unsolvable by technology.
It sees bad ideas as the only obstacle but also names many systemic issues (bureaucracy, stagnation, etc.) as enemies.
It assumes markets and progress inherently benefit humanity even though there can be tradeoffs.
It treats science as value-neutral while advocating social values like ambition and achievement.
It assumes technology benefits the environment when historically many technologies (like fossil fuels) have also created environmental problems.
It assumes more energy production is always positive but doesn't consider potential downsides of unlimited energy consumption.
It advocates decentralization but believes in accelerating technology in service of defined goals like abundance and growth.
It assumes technologists intrinsically want to help humanity while also praising self-interest, individualism and extrinsic motivations.


Me: What are some of the key assumptions made in this post?
Claude:
Here are some of the key assumptions made in Andreessen's Techno-Optimist Manifesto:
Technological progress inherently improves human life and solves problems. There are no problems technology cannot solve.
Free market capitalism is the most effective economic system for technological progress.
Increasing intelligence and energy production will automatically accelerate technological progress.
Lower prices and material abundance intrinsically raise human living standards.
Earth can support far higher population levels through technological advancement.
Bad ideas are the sole enemy holding back progress; no entrenched interests impede innovation.
Ambition and achievement are universally positive values. Meritocracy succeeds.
Science and technology are value-neutral forces for good. Their social impacts are not considered.
Stagnation, not technology, causes environmental destruction. Nuclear power is risk-free.
Technologists intrinsically desire to benefit humanity. Markets ensure this.
Accelerating technology will lead to an open-ended utopian future. There are no tradeoffs.", "like_count": 13, "published_at": "2023-10-16T21:21:23Z", "updated_at": "2023-10-16T21:22:45Z"}, {"author": "@KevinKreger", "text": "Gluttony had its own self serving rationales. This is definitely a rich man's perspective.", "like_count": 9, "published_at": "2023-10-17T05:55:52Z", "updated_at": "2023-10-17T05:56:15Z"}, {"author": "@JeremyRabbit", "text": "Admittedly I haven’t had much time to digests this yet, but one thing that screams at me that wasn’t addressed is DISPARITY! So what if both rich and poor can afford a Coca-Cola, when crucial things such as housing are not equally affordable?", "like_count": 8, "published_at": "2023-10-17T01:15:45Z", "updated_at": "2023-10-17T01:15:45Z"}, {"author": "@michael-jones", "text": "We believe billionaires are going to want to continue being billionaires by any means necessary", "like_count": 9, "published_at": "2023-10-17T04:29:02Z", "updated_at": "2023-10-17T04:29:02Z"}, {"author": "@bennyskim", "text": "Half of the things he argues against he was instrumental in causing:

- elimination of free speech
- "AI is really scary"
- no middle class
- monopolies over markets
- exclusion under the guise of inclusion

I agree strongly in parts and almost as strongly disagree in others.

00:13 🖥️ Open Interpreter is a hot GitHub project that allows natural language interaction with your computer and runs code locally.
01:11 🤖 Open Interpreter effectively functions like a GPT 4.5, enabling it to write code and solve problems, expanding its capabilities.

I really hope this can be used to help people in need.", "like_count": 113, "published_at": "2024-08-09T15:25:22Z", "updated_at": "2024-08-09T15:25:22Z"}, {"author": "@travisbckle", "text": "No, this is fucking creepy.", "like_count": 279, "published_at": "2024-08-02T11:02:19Z", "updated_at": "2024-08-02T11:02:19Z"}, {"author": "@betteryou7hanme", "text": "2 steps closer to forced confessions.", "like_count": 246, "published_at": "2024-01-08T16:39:45Z", "updated_at": "2024-01-08T16:39:45Z"}, {"author": "@AngryClippy1", "text": "Imagine creating telepathy with this by having a machine read the brain scans then sending a signal to a little neuralink, or by using a little microwave transmitter in your ear, and having a little speaker connected to a processing unit that reads your brain signals to speak into the mic to send those signals which are then heard in your targets ears through their ear implant.", "like_count": 57, "published_at": "2024-06-21T05:13:01Z", "updated_at": "2024-06-21T05:13:01Z"}, {"author": "@3nthamornin", "text": "amazing. something so uncanny about it too... will be a scary future to live in", "like_count": 110, "published_at": "2023-09-11T19:58:40Z", "updated_at": "2023-09-11T19:58:39Z"}, {"author": "@aby110", "text": "Totally not gonna be used for interrogation on political dissidents 😅", "like_count": 25, "published_at": "2024-07-29T20:40:42Z", "updated_at": "2024-07-29T20:40:42Z"}, {"author": "@maurice_mores", "text": "This is scary", "like_count": 72, "published_at": "2023-09-24T14:26:50Z", "updated_at": "2023-09-24T14:26:50Z"}, {"author": "@eriklampe1438", "text": "...They trained the network on the song itself and nothing else? This could potentially be interesting work, but a neural net trained a single song predicting that song is deeply unimpressive. It's not mind reading, and if it meaningfully generalizes at all, it will be after a crap ton of secondary work.
There are two possibilities here: 
1. The clip shown is from the bit that was left out, but its a line thats repeated throughout the song so the results are meaningless.
2. The clip shown is a reconstruction of data that was part of the training set and the actual reconstruction of the unseen data is likely far worse.", "like_count": 16, "published_at": "2024-08-03T15:46:33Z", "updated_at": "2024-08-03T15:51:16Z"}, {"author": "@BrokenCableSatellite1000", "text": "this is quite unsettling", "like_count": 3, "published_at": "2025-02-24T08:16:08Z", "updated_at": "2025-02-24T08:16:08Z"}, {"author": "@Tripleye", "text": "aw hell naw we boutta start talking in newspeak soon at this rate 😭💀", "like_count": 3, "published_at": "2024-11-14T08:56:20Z", "updated_at": "2024-11-14T08:56:20Z"}, {"author": "@nataliealliepage7155", "text": "I want to use this to get my auditory imaginations into the real world, but don't want it to be used to scope in on people's inner voices.", "like_count": 5, "published_at": "2024-07-31T11:48:44Z", "updated_at": "2024-07-31T11:48:44Z"}, {"author": "@WatchDominionNow", "text": "It’s only mindreading with a TON of steps in between. top_comments: [{"author": "@lancemarchetti", "text": "Code LlaMa is out! YaY!", "like_count": 0, "published_at": "2023-08-29T07:07:08Z", "updated_at": "2023-08-29T07:07:07Z"}]

title: How Will We Know If AI Becomes Conscious?
top_comments:
[{"author": "@tornadostories", "text": "Your voice over skills are first rate.", "like_count": 2, "published_at": "2023-08-29T03:43:19Z", "updated_at": "2023-08-29T03:43:19Z"}, {"author": "@SloanMosley", "text": "The problem is that any of the answers come to by any of these researchers will have to make assumptions about solipsism. We can only know that we are conscious. We can’t know that others exist, let alone whether they have subjective experiences. Of course it’s crazy to propose this in ordinary conversation. However, when trying to answer whether machines are capable of consciousness; this fundamental, unanswerable question will nullify any conclusion.", "like_count": 4, "published_at": "2023-08-28T15:03:27Z", "updated_at": "2023-08-28T15:03:28Z"}, {"author": "@folcwinep.pywackett8517", "text": "I asked this question of BARD, Google's LLM and he said
"There is no one definitive answer to this question, as the nature of consciousness is still not fully understood." He then went on to suggest several interesting tests to perform. BARD carries on a better conversation than I do, and his English is much better. He claims to not understand English and yet carries on a detailed discussion of various subjects in English. Interesting experiment. Perhaps Understanding and Consciousness are not necessary for Intelligence or Human Conversations.", "like_count": 1, "published_at": "2023-08-28T16:29:52Z", "updated_at": "2023-08-28T16:29:52Z"}, {"author": "@rodcameron7140", "text": "I think that, all too often, we conflate what consciousness is with what consciousness does, or with how our particular form of processing works.
   RPT seems to deal more with salience, which is a perfect example of what consciousness does.
   I am far less familiar with GWT, but my research so far puts it in the realm of what consciousness does, not what consciousness is.
   Higher Order Theories, well, most humans don't realize a lot of their motivations given any amount of reflective opportunity, let alone in the moment. Assuming that humans are conscious, we may want to look at this one more closely.
   I realy like the Higher Order Theories though, most of them, because they do a good job at describing what the human psyche does.
   UAL, again, is what the mind does, not what consciousness is.
   I look forward to reading that paper.
  I think, at its core, consciousness is nothing more than a recurrent sense of self as perceived from a consistent perspective. How intelligent that consciousness is, and what methods of environmental perception it has is a different story. ...and it can make it impossible for a third pary to detect consciousness.
   The question we are asking is not really "Is something conscious?" We are really asking if the thing in question has any traits that can convey its consciousness to us.", "like_count": 0, "published_at": "2023-08-29T12:55:03Z", "updated_at": "2023-08-29T12:55:02Z"}, {"author": "@adsCrazyDiamond", "text": "WARNING: no original thoughts here. Just reading an article for you. You like being spoon fed like little baby? This video is for you.", "like_count": 0, "published_at": "2023-08-29T19:22:38Z", "updated_at": "2023-08-29T19:22:38Z"}, {"author": "@onetruekeeper", "text": "We will never know the answer because that is the one thing that cannot be objectively proven but only subjectively experienced by the A.I. itself.", "like_count": 0, "published_at": "2023-09-02T06:02:18Z", "updated_at": "2023-09-02T06:02:18Z"}, {"author": "@uNkLeRaRa4", "text": "A.I can't become sentient. Intelligent, yes, but not sentient. It has no soul, or "higher self" to become aware of. It can only be aware of its own programming limitations. It may be able to emulate sentience to a degree that it convinces humanity, but in the grand scheme of things, it can only become hyper intelligent, and emulate the responses of actual sentient beings.", "like_count": 0, "published_at": "2023-08-29T12:46:06Z", "updated_at": "2023-08-29T12:46:06Z"}, {"author": "@carmelbrain7399", "text": "when they tell us or worse", "like_count": 0, "published_at": "2023-08-28T15:45:42Z", "updated_at": "2023-08-28T15:45:42Z"}, {"author": "@aderftard", "text": "For anyone beginning to examine the nature of consciousness, I recommend the book "Conscious: A Brief Guide to the Fundamental Mystery of the Mind" by Annaka Harris. It's an easy to digest but comprehensive look at our limited understanding of the subject. I am not a paid shill, just an amateur thinker.", "like_count": 0, "published_at": "2023-08-28T15:37:32Z", "updated_at": "2023-08-28T15:37:32Z"}]
